snippet: A state council is set to vote on a deal to turn over dialysis at four of the city’s public hospitals to a for-profit franchise, though data show it did not perform as well as the hospitals themselves.
abstract: New York State Public Health and Planning Council is set to vote on deal to turn over dialysis at four of New York City's hospitals to for-profit franchise Big Apple Dialysis; deal, approved more in 2013, will save city's financially troubled hospital system $150 million over next nine years, but critics say government data shows company's dialysis centers did not perform as well as hospitals themselves.
lead_paragraph: A state council is set to vote on a deal to turn over dialysis at four of the city’s public hospitals to a for-profit franchise, though data show it did not perform as well as the hospitals themselves.

headline.main: Hospitals’ Dialysis Plan Is Under New Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Hospitals’ Dialysis Plan Is Under New Scrutiny
